alert.note: Alert for Anne Arundel; Calvert; Charles; Prince Georges; St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 16 at 4:54PM EDT until May 16 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN ANNE ARUNDEL...NORTHERN ST. MARYS...CALVERT... SOUTHEASTERN PRINCE GEORGES AND NORTHEASTERN CHARLES COUNTIES... At 454 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Marlton, or near Clinton, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Waldorf, Clinton, Forestville, Mayo, Shady Side, Chesapeake Beach, Deale, Prince Frederick, Upper Marlboro, Breezy Point, Rhode River, Andrews Air Force Base, Camp Springs, Rosaryville, Marlton, Dunkirk, Saint Leonard, Saint Charles, Brandywine and District Heights. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Anne Arundel; Calvert; Charles; Prince Georges; St. Marys
